#PILT provides revenue to local governments in areas surrounded by federal land – like many communities in Alaska.

Unlike private lands, federal lands are not subject to local taxes, often making it difficult for rural communities to budget for essential services. This is where the Payments in Lieu of Taxes (#PILT) program comes in…

No federal, state, or local entities should be forced into desperate bidding wars to provide essential workers with the equipment they need to stay safe and healthy. 
 
No medical professional should have to wear a garbage bag because they could not get proper PPE.

The Made in America: Preparation for a Pandemic Act creates a tax credit to assist manufacturers with the costs of developing or expanding domestic sources for the end-to-end production of PPE goods within the US.

The Made in America: Preparation for a Pandemic Act requires 25% of that PPE be produced in the US, strengthening our domestic supply chains and ensuring Americans have the tools to manufacture lifesaving supplies when the nation needs them most.
The Made in America: Preparation for a Pandemic Act requires that the Strategic National Stockpile maintain at least enough PPE to sustain the U.S. through a year of a global pandemic.

That's why, I am introducing the Made in America: Preparation for a Pandemic Act which would guarantee an adequate stock of PPE in the Strategic National Stockpile at all times & establish domestic supply chain incentives that put Americans to work building the materials we need.

FEMA’s Supply Chain Stabilization Task Force projected a shortage of approximately 100 million gowns and 40 million N95 respirators this month. 
 
More than 400 healthcare workers have died from coronavirus, and shortages of PPE have played a significant role in this crisis.

PPE shortages remain a critical challenge in fighting the #coronavirus pandemic. 
 
The need for the Made in America: Preparation for a Pandemic Act could not be more urgent.

Having strong domestic production of PPE is absolutely essential to keeping Americans safe during a global pandemic. 
 
Unfortunately, too many lives have been lost unnecessarily because broken global supply chains left our essential workers without the equipment they needed.

Today, I joined members of NYC’s fashion industry to unveil my new bill, the Made in America: Preparation for a Pandemic Act. 
 
This bill is an important step toward building our domestic supply chains & making sure our nation is prepared for any future pandemic.

March 17, 2017: I reintroduced a bipartisan bill to reform Pentagon’s 1033 Program that distributes surplus military-grade weapons to local law enforcement departments without civilian governmental approval: https://hankjohnson.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/rep-johnson-reintroduces-bipartisan-bill-reform-pentagon-s-1033-program @RepBobbyRush @RepJayapal @RepJerryNadler

March 4, 2015: I reintroduced the bipartisan bill to de-militarize police: https://hankjohnson.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/rep-johnson-reintroduces-bipartisan-bill-de-militarize-police @washingtonpost http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ecbz-KoWAAA1CIt.jpg

1996-2020: In a fundamentally misguided effort to stop Americans from using drugs, the Congress allowed the DOD to provide surplus military equipment – often from warzones overseas – to local police for free. To date, more than $5 billion in this equipment has been transferred.

Sept. 16, 2014: We introduced bi-partisan: The Stop Militarizing Law Enforcement Act, a bill to de-militarize police; place restrictions on and bring transparency measures to the DOD Program that transfers surplus military equipment to state and local law enforcement agencies.

Aug. 28, 2014: With the streets of Ferguson looking like a war zone, police took on the look of soldiers clad in camouflage and riot gear as they aimed their assault weapons at peaceful demonstrators from the turret of an armored personnel carrier: https://hankjohnson.house.gov/media-center/editorials/stop-police-militarization http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ecbz9mCXgAEehRa.jpg

Aug. 20, 2014: Laying the groundwork to reform the Pentagon’s 1033 Program that gives military-grade weapons to local law enforcement departmerns: https://www.nytimes.com/2014/08/20/upshot/data-on-transfer-of-military-gear-to-police-departments.html?rref=upshot&abt=0002&abg=1&_r=0 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ecbz9IYXkAEMFxb.jpg
